data.title: DOF Far/Near Blur causes artifacts when glow is enabled
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7 64bit
Godot 3.0 built from July 18th source (although I've seen this in earlier versions)
Running on a GeForce GTX 760

**Issue description:**
When you have both DOF Far Blur (or Near Blur) and Glow enabled, the glow texture becomes corrupted, as seen in the gif below:

![image](https://media.giphy.com/media/3oeHLtzvvp9xro7UD6/giphy.gif)

**Steps to reproduce:**
Just enable DOF Far Blur and Glow at the same time

data.title: KinematicBody::_move() updates collision list
data.body:
This is done so that the results wouldn't need to be accessed through a Dictionary.

This is an alternative solution to: #9751

data.title: Added KinematicCollision
data.body:
This was done so that the output of KinematicBody's `move()` and `move_and_slide()` would be the same. In addition, by eliminating the use of Dictionary, new users can more easily discover the available output parameters in the documentation.

While this would technically be a breaking change, it is a breaking change of something that was pushed recently, so impact should be minimal.

data.title: AnimationTree nodes sliders fixes
data.body:
This commit will ensure that step property of concrete `Range` widgets which are used by `AnimationTreePlayer` will be set to 0.01 (one percent). I also changed default `value` of `Range` widget property to 0 from 1 (1 don't make any sense for me when min = 0).

Also I'm wondering why default value for step is 1.0 (100%), I don't think that makes a lot of sense. Also default range is 0-100 (0%-10 000%)? We actually have somewhere in Godot UI such slider? Mean the one that uses those defaults?
Current defaults are defined here: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/scene/gui/range.cpp#L275

This pr will close #8093

data.title: AnimationTree sliders fix
data.body:
This commit will ensure that `step property of concrete `Range` widgets which are used by `AnimationTreePlayer` will be set to 0.01 (one percent).

However I'm wondering why default values for step is 1.0 (100%), I don't think that makes a lot of sense. Also default range is 0-100 (0%-10 000%). 
We actually have somewhere in Godot UI such slider? Mean the one that uses those defaults? 
Current default in range: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/scene/gui/range.cpp#L275

This pr will close #8093

data.title: Editor loads GDNative libraries
data.body:
Windows 10 x64, Godot 2a0c0db028c84c75f4a927d0fd400449f3236952

**Issue description:**
When opening project with a GDNative library in it, the editor loads the referenced libraries, even though they are not used by the editor. This is a significant problem when developing on Windows, because your build script cannot override the loaded DLL, so you have to close the editor and open it again which is a considerable waste of time.

Expected behaviour is that the DLL is only loaded if it's a part of editor plugin, not when it is a part of the application being developed.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Build a GDNative library (e.g. using [C++ bindings](https://github.com/GodotNativeTools/cpp_bindings)) and ensure you have the DLL specified in the library's .tres file as a part of your project.
2. Open the project in the editor.
3. Try to delete or replace the DLL. You will get access errors.

data.title: Label: add auto_height
data.body:
Fixes #7679 if merged.

I've seen #4379 and I'm not sure why width-based height would not work. (Width affects height, not the other way around.)
I have not experienced any issues so far, no noticeable adjustment loops.

![ezgif-1-ba8dcc7f9c](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26753932/28460071-8dd9c258-6e3a-11e7-9f37-70c96c4a2435.gif)

More screencast: [VBoxContainer](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26753932/28455123-21a0541a-6e28-11e7-9bc5-a6740fea6da4.gif), [HBoxContainer](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26753932/28455127-26514d2a-6e28-11e7-9307-7742fc12bd53.gif), [GridContainer](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26753932/28461019-f0bac1f2-6e3e-11e7-89b9-44b82ce9ddad.gif)

data.title: OSX Right-Click (Ctrl-Click) doesn't work.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
MacOS Sierra 10.12.5
MacBook Pro (Retina, 15-inch, Late 2013)
Godot Engine v2.1.3.stable.official

**Issue description:**
*Expected Behavior:* `Ctrl-Click` on a node opens context menu. `Ctrl-Click` on OSX should give the same result as Right-Click on Windows. 

*Actual Behavior:* `Ctrl-Click` behaves exactly like `Left-Click` (i.e. holding `Ctrl` while clicking has no effect)


**Steps to reproduce:**

1. Open New Project
2. Add any node to scene.
3. `Ctrl-click` the node in the Scene dock
4. No context menu...

No example project included. Steps to reproduce will work on a new empty project.

data.title: Enhanced About dialog, Add ItemList auto_height
data.body:
Add set/has_auto_height for ItemList to automatically set minimum size by content.
Add hash to About dialog.
Resize About dialog so that dev list appears in 3 columns.

Fixes #9736

data.title: updated project manager to use new project.godot values
data.body:
Since the project.godot format was modified, Project Manager shows (new/updated) projects as "Unnamed Project", with no icon and "Run" didn't work. This fixes that by just changing the config keys being used in project_manager.cpp. Unfortunately, all your older projects appear as "Unnamed" now.

Apologies for the unsolicited PR but it seems like a small and obvious fix and doing it took less time than writing an issue/this. Cheers!

data.title: Fix issues with custom nodes in visual script
data.body:
- Doesn't crash anymore.
- Inputs are properly transferred.
- Ports are updated when the script changes.

data.title: Godot freeze computer, when shadow contact set to 1
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Fedora NVidia GTX 900 series, Driver 381.22 Godot version: 2a0c0db028c84c75f4a927d0fd400449f3236952

**Issue description:**
Godots starts using a LOT of CPU, causing the entire OS to freeze, sometimes im even unable to close godot.


**Steps to reproduce:**
Open the attached project and move the camera towards the walls until you start to touch them (i was using the freelook mode). !WARNING DOING THIS MIGHT FREEZE YOUR COMPUTER, SO TRY TO CLOSE GODOT AS SOON AS POSSIBLE IF IT STARTS TO SLOW DOWN.

As far as i can tell this only happens when the Directional Light shadow contact is set to 1 (dont really know if lower values also work) but with contact set to 0 it does not happen, on 1 this will always happen.


**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
[computer_freeze_test.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1163959/computer_freeze_test.zip)

data.title: Error compiling module for android
data.body:
Debian, Godot source Git

I try to compile with the command below:

`scons platform=android target=release
`
I'm trying to compile the APKS. Using this module and am getting this error:

https://github.com/kloder-games/godot-admob

```
scons: Reading SConscript files ...
sh: 1: i586-mingw32msvc-gcc: not found
sh: 1: i686-w64-mingw32-gcc: not found
UnboundLocalError: local variable 'can_vectorize' referenced before assignment:
  File "/home/user/godot-master-3/SConstruct", line 273:
    detect.configure(env)
  File "./platform/android/detect.py", line 95:
    if (can_vectorize):

```
Why am I compiling on the git version? Because I need to use multiplayer, I'm at the same time studying Enet and trying to create a multiplayer module for godot, but the time is running, I would like to try this new API before continuing to write. And I need this module (admob) that is already integrated with my app. So what I thought, I'm going to try to compile it first, if it works out and everything works, I start migrating my project to the new godot.

data.title: Better custom nodes workflow for Visual Script
data.body:
Custom nodes for Visual Scripts are not in really good state right now (despite the fact that documentation is absent and it causes some crashes). The workflow is a bit convoluted, especially because it is geared towards people with lesser programming experience.

For those who don't know, adding a custom node to a visual script requires these steps:

- Add a `Custom Node` to the VS, from the `Custom` category.
- Select (in the Inspector) the right script with the custom node code.
- ~Close and reopen the VS, because it does not reload.~ (fixed by #9741)
- Use the new node.

This is how I think custom nodes should be added:

- Find the wanted custom node in the `Available Nodes` panel.
- Drop it into place and use it.

My suggestion to make this work is quite simple: add some `EditorPlugin` function that adds a custom node to the VS editor. Then it'll just be a matter of calling `add_custom_vs_node(name, category, script)` from a plugin to be able to use it in the scripts.

The VS editor would just automate the process that is currently done manually.

data.title: Changes to mesh geometry do not update until scene close
data.body: Running 3.0 alpha builds compiled on my system. Editing mesh geometry and re-exporting it does not update the mesh within the editor until you close and reopen the scene. If you run the scene with F6, the updated geometry is shown. Has happened while working with two meshes.

Fixes #9638

Closed pull request #9714 because I messed up with commits and panicked, sorry!

data.title: custom_features: fix typo
KinematicBody2D gets stuck in oneway collider if touching wall at the same time
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Kubuntu 17.04, Godot git master from today

**Issue description:**
I created a platform I wanted the character to be able to jump through and land on top of. It works as expected if you are standing underneath the platform and jump. but, if you are touching a wall at the same time the character gets stuck in the platform and is_on_floor return true. 

**Steps to reproduce:**
I incuded a test scene. Just run to the right wall, and jump (up arrow) while still running towards the wall so it receives the wall collision too. 

[collision_bug2.tar.gz](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1161828/collision_bug2.tar.gz)
